Presenting Problem / Chief Complaint: The patient expresses a desire to work on their mental health and cope better, indicating a focus on their emotional well-being and past relationships
History of Present Illness (HPI): The patient has drafted a message to their family but hesitates to send it due to fear of their reaction. They feel a mix of relief and anxiety about expressing their feelings
Risk Assessment: The patient acknowledges fear of rejection when considering reaching out to family and sharing their writing, yet shows willingness to take brave steps towards connection and feedback
Physiological Observations: The patient reports feeling more centered and ready to face the day after practicing mindfulness, indicating positive physiological responses to their routine
Current Functional Status: The patient has been actively networking for job opportunities and feels supported by former colleagues, also making progress in their writing
Progress Evaluation: The patient notes improvements in handling stress and emotional reactions, suggesting positive progress in their mental health journey
Therapeutic Interventions: The patient is encouraged to continue practicing mindfulness and consider sharing their writing for feedback
Next Steps: The patient expresses interest in exploring feelings about past relationships in future sessions, indicating a focus on deeper emotional work
